required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Platform Switching on Single Implants in the Esthetic Zone, Following Flapless Surgery and Early-Loading Protocols

brief_summary.textblock: The impact of platform switching with flapless surgery on early-loaded single-tooth implants on esthetic outcomes.

detailed_description.textblock: Evaluation of clinical, radiographic and microbial outcomes of single implants with platform switching, compared to those with conventional platform.

primary_outcome.description: (Silness and Loe 1964). 0 represented the absence of plaque. 1 was the presence of plaque at gingival margin. 2 was the presence of visible plaque; whereas 3 was recorded if abundant plaque was observed

(Loe 1967) As for GI, normal gingival was scored as 0. 1 meant the presence of mild inflammation, slight change in color, slight edema and no BOP. Moderate inflammation was represented by 2, inclusive of the presence of gingival redness, edema, glazing and BOP. Severe inflammation with marked redness, edema, ulceration and spontaneous bleeding was scaled as 3

Severe inflammation with marked redness, edema, ulceration and spontaneous bleeding was scaled as 3

primary_outcome.time_frame: post-operative 2 weeks, immediately after crown delivery, 3, 6, and 12 months post-loading
primary_outcome.description: the vertical distance between alveolar crest to platform level (both mesial and distal)
the distance from the highest point of alveolar crest to the base of the maxillary arch
the distance from the highest point of alveolar crest to the base of the maxillary arch
the distance between the most prominent point on labial and palatal surfaces at the level of 3mm below the crest
the distance between the most prominent point on labial and palatal surfaces at the level of 3mm below the crest
the distance between the most prominent point on labial and palatal surfaces at the level of 10 mm below the crest

primary_outcome.measure: the presence of perforation or dehiscence
primary_outcome.description: using CBCT scan

secondary_outcome.description: pain, bleeding, swelling and overall discomfort
comfort, function (chewing/speaking), esthetics, and overall satisfaction

intervention.other_name: Zimmer TSV™, Zimmer Dental Inc., Carlsbad, CA

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients should be at least 18 years old and not currently pregnant
- Systemically healthy with no medical contraindications to implant surgery
- Having intact opposite tooth to proposed implant sites
- The edentulous ridge with minimal ridge deformities.
Exclusion Criteria:
- unstable medical status or conditions which may compromise wound healing
- osseous metabolic disorders (e.g., osteoporosis, Paget's disease etc.)
- uncontrolled dental or periodontal diseases
- edentulous ridges with the presence of fibrous dysplasia, severe tissue undercut, residual root, as well as insufficient dimensions or volume

facility.name: Graduate Periodontics, Department of Periodontics and Oral Medicine, University of Michigan School of Dentistry
